body.p: To His Excellency Thos E. Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky;

Your petitioner the undersigned N. Sandifer Presiding Judge of the Garrard County Court respectfully states that on the 17th day of November 1862 one James H. Smith did unlawfully and feloniously shoot, kill and murder in the town of Lancaster one Joshua Burdett, a citizen of the town aforesaid; and that James H. Smith is now and has been for more than a year last past absent and so secrets himself that no officer of this commonwealth has been able to bring him before the proper tribunal; and that the case of murder is one of very extremely aggravated character: Wherefore your petitioner asks and requests that as large a reward be offered for the apprehension of and delivery of said J. H. Smith to Jailor of Garrard County Ky as your Excellency may deem proper under the circumstances
N Sandifer P, J, G, C, C
